intro: Jacquemontia ferruginea var. elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining vines and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of pink to purple blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in a fine, rusty-colored pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks.
